thread.title: ESPN's "The Party" attracts a wide spectrum of stars
thread.title_full: ESPN's "The Party" attracts a wide spectrum of stars

author: Craig Hlavaty, Houston Chronicle
title: ESPN's "The Party" attracts a wide spectrum of stars
text:

HOUSTON, TX - FEBRUARY 03: (L-R) NFL player Sterling Shepard, recording artist Fergie and model Chanel Iman attend the 13th Annual ESPN The Party on February 3, 2017 in Houston, Texas. Photo: Gustavo Caballero, Getty Images For ESPN Image 28 of 28 ESPN's "The Party" attracts a wide spectrum of stars 1 / 28 Back to Gallery 

ESPN's Super Bowl bash dubbed "The Party" was held just south of I-10 off Summer Street on Friday night. 
The interior of a warehouse was decorated in what can only be described as construction chic with stray cherry pickers scattered throughout next to a full service bars where vodka and Miller Lite flowed. A few Alfa Romeo sports cars - a party sponsor- were parked inside for posing purposes. 
Ridiculously bright LED screens made the front ESPN-branded scaffolding seemingly visible from the International Space Station. 
The red carpet began humming just after 10 p.m. with sports stars and other celebs holding court in the way into the party. This week's ubiquitous DJ Khaled made a loud entrance, Snapchatting along the way. Actor Anthony Anderson, coach Rex Ryan, and commentator Stephen A. Smith soon followed after Khaled. 
Most notably New York Giants receiver Odell Beckham Jr. skipped the fanfare and ducked into the party. Reality star Kendra Wilkinson made a quick red carpet appearance and made her way inside. 
Houston Astros ace Dallas Keuchel, whose trademark beard looked fantastic as ever, told Chron.com that he's a Tom Brady fan but he thinks the future Hall of Famer might not earn that sixth ring on Sunday. 
"I'm a Tom Brady fan but I'm thinking the Falcons are going to take it I really do," Keuchel said. 
Good news Astros fans, his arm is feeling great after an injuring plagued 2016 campaign. 
"The arm's feeling good and I got my first bullpen the other day," he said. 
Minnesota Vikings running back and Texas native Adrian Peterson arrived in a studded black hoodie, joining ESPN legend Chris Berman on the red carpet nearby. 
Headliner Fergie arrived in a blue dress and did a turn for assembled and smoldered for the cameras. 
Outside just after midnight the likes of Michael Irvin and Tim Tebow were wading through security to get into the party.
